cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 85 mi north of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving north, then accelerating north-northeast toward the Florida Big Bend, then across southeast Georgia and near the South Carolina coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend (near Cedar Key/Indian Pass area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Altamaha Sound, GA to South Santee River, SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: None for South Carolina coast as of Advisory 11
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast (Englewood to Indian Pass), southeast Georgia and the South Carolina coast through South Santee River
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely Wednesday night into early Thursday; 69 % chance of ≥34 kt, 26 % chance of ≥50 kt, and 6 % chance of hurricane-force gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of inundation possible for the mouth of the St. Mary’s River to South Santee River, including Charleston Harbor.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 in of rain possible across eastern South Carolina, producing flash and urban flooding around Charleston.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands; dangerous surf and rip currents ahead of the storm.
